headline: Ellen's Chicken Cacciatore
description: Tender chicken thigh meat simmers in a savory tomato sauce for an Italian-inspired meal that's ready in just over an hour but tastes like it cooked for hours.

video.description: A sweet, tangy, and pleasant sauce.
video.name: Ellen's Chicken Cacciatore

name: Ellen's Chicken Cacciatore
recipeIngredient: 6 boneless, skinless chicken thighs - fat trimmed
1 (28 ounce) can diced tomatoes with juice
2 tablespoons dried rosemary, or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat, and brown the chicken thighs in the hot oil, about 5 minutes per side. Set the chicken aside.
In the same skillet, cook and stir the onion and mushrooms until the mushrooms have softened, about 10 minutes. Mix in the garlic, and cook until fragrant, 1 to 2 more minutes.
Pour in the tomatoes with their juice, white wine, orange juice, rosemary, salt, and black pepper, and stir until thoroughly combined.

Stir in the chicken pieces and any accumulated juices, cover the skillet, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until the chicken is tender and no longer pink inside, 30 to 40 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Very good.
This was delicious! I was not sure about the orange juice, but it was a wonderful addition to the flavor. I hope people will want to try it.

This turned out great. I substituted the juice from two clementines for the orange juice (I didn’t have any orange juice on hand). I also added two tablespoons of capers at the same time that the garlic was added. I finished it off by adding a can of tomato paste to thicken it up. My wife and I both loved it and we will be adding this to our regular rotation. It was excellent!
Delicious!

I’ve made this several times now, and the only modification I wound up with is to cut way back on the orange juice and add in some fresh squeezed lemon juice. I find the Pomi crushed mushrooms to be perfect for this. Definitely a family fav.
I made this and loved it! I added green peppers and black olives. Yum!! I loved the sauce as the recipe called for.

It had wonderful flavor and I did change it a bit. I didn’t use the orange juice, and I didn’t have rosemary by it’s self but used it in with other spices. I put cut in half Brussel sprouts in it and I used boneless and skinless thighs. I ate it without rice or pasta. It was great just as is with a little bit of sour dough bread to dip in it. Yummy

I have finally found a flavorful sauce! Made it for the first time and it was beyond delicious! It made the chicken taste so good. I used spaghetti noodles with the dish. So a meatless version would still taste amazing.
I made it with chicken breasts and it came out great !
Great recipe!! Delicious and very easy!!
I made this as written and let it “mature” for a couple of hours. OMG! So good!

I did make this but made a few changes. Left out the oj and used tomato sauce. 
Served it over rice. I’ll make this again.
Delicious! And fairly simple. Love it!
True story - the sauce does have many layers of flavor that taste like you’ve been working on it all day. Really enjoyable.

I made this tonight. The only thing I changed was, that I didn't add the dried rosemary. I added one sprig of fresh. I did add a few shakes of italian seasonings. After I browned the chicken thighs, cooked the onions and mushrooms, I put it in my crock pot. The chicken was really tender. It all smelled wonderful! My husband and I both felt the flavor was pretty bland though. I think if I make it again, I'll add more seasonings. I served it over rice hoping the thin liquid would stick to it. It did. I think I'll take other's advice and add tomato paste if I make it again. Thanks for sharing though!
Made according to recipe with exception of orange juice which I didn’t have. Turned out great with nice rich flavours.
Best ever Chicken Cacciatore ever. Made it for dinner and y husband can't wait until I make it again.
Switched up the cans of tomato’s with rotel cans for some added flavor and spice

I have an aversion to removing fat. What will happen to the taste if I do not remove the skin or extra fat? Also, if I substitute water chestnuts for mushrooms (only tasteless canned varieties are available here in the Philippines)? Thanks!
I added some Italian seasoning. My boyfriend loved it!!

Loved the addition of Fresh Rosemary and Orange Juice.. Love to make exactly as listed for first time around and not sure I would change it. Might personalize it with fresh Parsley. Used some frozen cherry tomatoes from my garden last summer and they were perfect. then added the tomatoes as called for. Delicious.
Delicious and easy to make. I used can mushrooms because I had no fresh. Next time I would use fresh mushrooms. With left overs I cut up and had soup. Thanks Ellen.

This one’s a winner!! My husband absolutely loved it! It’s a great base recipe but like most cooks, I tend to tweak recipes to our own particular tastes & what I have on hand. In this case, I omitted the mushrooms, used crushed tomatoes instead of diced tomatoes, reduced the rosemary & added a little thyme. We like to kick our sauces up a notch so I added about 1 1/2 tsp of crushed red pepper flakes. I also took the lid off after the 40 minutes of simmering & let the sauce cook down a bit before serving it over whole wheat linguini noodles.
my family really liked this. it did get better overnight. made as is and served it with polenta one time and pasta once. will certainly make this again!

The flavor was there, and the chicken came out well. This just wasn’t how I typically like this dish. There are probably lots of tweaks you could make to it to make it your own, so that’s the route I’ll take when I make it again.
This was excellent! Used Italian diced tomatoes because that what I had and it turned out fantastic.

I used this recipe as a template, but the results were still excellent, so five stars for the flexibility. I didn’t have orange juice so I substituted apple cider. I added a can of tomato sauce and stewed tomatoes as well as peppers.

The only change I made was to eliminate the onion--since I am highly allergic! The rest was as indicated. It was delicious! My husband, who doesn't like "healthy" recipes just because (!!!), thought this was delicious from the first bite.

I made this tonight and followed the recipe pretty closely. I used fresh garden tomatoes that I cooked down. I didn't have enough mushrooms so I added one small eggplant from the garden because I thought it would blend well with the other ingredients. I had chicken legs not thighs. I resisted adding anything different because I was curious to see if we would like this. It turned out to be delicious! This one's a keeper and my husband says it's his new favorite. 

I served it with angel hair pasta. I didn't add tomato paste or cheese and I'm glad I didn't. Thank you for sharing this recipe.

I used one can (14 oz) crushed tomatoes instead of diced so the recipe wouldn't be so tomato-chunky. It worked out great. I don't like mushrooms, so I left those out of the recipe. I used chicken breasts instead of thighs - I don't recommend that since they got so dry. Definitely follow the recipe and use thighs. I served with fresh, shredded parmesan. Delicious!
Thanks for sharing Ellen. This was delicious as is.
This was a great recipe, simple but very tasty. I cut the chicken thighs so they would cook faster but otherwise made as written. Will certainly be making again.
Delicious. Family bonus. Made 2 batches. You don’t need dry wine. It’s great with regular white.
William make again
I did everything the same except I put it in a casserole dish and baked it in the oven. It was very, very good.
Fantastic! I didn't change a thing. It was so tasty. A hit with the whole family!
Had no OJ, so zested and squeezed a lemon, added 1 Tblsp sugar, reduced a little longer than called for, served with angel hair pasta. Very very simple and very very delicious.
This was delicious! My husband hates tomatoes so I used crushed tomatoes and added chopped red & orange peppers. Will go on my favorites list!

I was very pleased with the results of this recipe. I am a picky eater and some ingredients I can't handle. However, I made this recipe and used the onion and garlic at the beginning, but took it out before adding tomatoes and chicken. I left a very small amount in the skillet and the results were still very good. The chicken was very tender, and the recipe was easy to follow, with not too many directions or ingredients. This is a great recipe in taste, easy instructions, ingredient that are mostly in cupboard, and minimal time overall in preparation to actually eating.
it was good.... but missing a lot of flavor we felt. Chicken comes out very tender which was awesome.
I had everything on the list but this is very bland.
I used bone in and skin on thighs. Easy to make, thighs were very tender and sauce had a well balanced flavor. Browned thighs to crisp up the skin and to reduce fat in the dish. I would make again
Didn't have wine so used chicken broth. Added a small can of tomato paste...very good...will make again!
Came out very good, I added a little tomato paste and some zucchini. Everyone thought it was a keeper. Will definitely be made again.

Good recipe, but not amazing. It was MUCH better the second day. I used ten (10) boneless skinless chicken thighs. There was plenty of sauce for that number of thighs. I'm very glad I used the larger amount of chicken because the leftovers were fantastic.

I've been searching for a homemade cacciatore recipe for years that was as great as my Sister's she made when I was young! I add a trio of red,yellow,and orange bellpeppers,&that gives it a ton of extra flavor,along w/fresh Rosemary etc! My Hubby loves it so much! 10 out of 10 w/2 thumbs up!!

Ellen I do not know where you came up with the bizzaro idea to use orange juice but it was brilliant. The only things I changed was to substitute chicken broth for wine and to cut way back on rosemary as I do not like it. The dinner was amazing. For those who thought the sauce was runny just take the lid off during the last 20 minutes of cooking. I thought it was perfect.
Oh wow, delicious!! I didn't have the wine so I hesitantly subbed out chicken stock, it worked great! Used tiny baby bella mushrooms. This had tons of flavor and was perfect served over cauli rice :)
Followed as written. Delicious!

Didn't have white wine, so used the red on hand. I cut back a bit on the oj just in case it didn't work well with the red wine. Otherwise followed the recipe. Entire family really enjoyed it. Served with a risotto and green beans. Will make again (and with the white next time)!

Enjoyed the recipe but can't give it five because I altered the recipe slightly. Instead of using rosemary, I used oregano, I removed the lid after 10 minutes and let it cook down a bit, I then added about two heaping spoonfuls of tomato paste and a teaspoon of sugar. Both me and my hubby enjoyed the end result. I will try this again after I get some rosemary. Thanks.

Clearly a keeper. Mostly used as a guide and incorporated as many ingredients I could from the pantry.
More of a simple version. The white wine a must for browning the chicken thighs. Kicks this whole dish up a notch! Enjoy!
4 stars as written. Cut the rosemary to 1 Tbs and added a little cayenne.

The sauce was too tangy for my taste. I started over again and left out the orange juice. Instead I added some chicken broth. I marinated my chicken for about an hour with a mixture of white wine a touch of adobo, garlic powder and water I browned my chicken with a little bit of olive oil and butter. I served it over pasta instead of rice. Much better for my taste

This is a perfectly seasoned recipe. The leftover sauce can be re-purposed many ways. I saw the one reviewer made a soup. I froze my leftover sauce and will probably add some ital. sausage and do a lasagna or some other casserole. Very tasty with the original ingredients. Thank you!

It was good, but for me, there was a lot of liquid when the chicken was done. I added new potatoes to compensate. 
Personally, I thought 2 tablespoons of Rosemary was too much, so I used only 1 large tablespoon. I will probably do this again, but will grind the Rosemary.
Because my wife has a great fondness for artichoke hearts, I added a jar of them. The result was very tasty and definitely a make again.
Different. Easy. Really good!

I chose this recipe because it does not use peppers. Although I love them, my family does not. I made this with boneless, skinless chicken breasts and sliced baby portabella mushrooms. When the cacciatore was finished cooking, I sliced the breasts and returned them to the sauce. I served this over medium pasta shells with lots of Locatelli. This sauce has an excellent flavor, and I will definitely make it again. Changes I might make next time -- crushed tomatoes vs the diced; and crushed rosemary vs the "sticks" (just texture preferences). Try this one! You won't be disappointed!

Yummy! I used 2 split breasts, cut up and deboned because that is what I had on hand. I also chopped up a pint of grape tomatoes to use them up instead of a can of diced tomatoes. I added artichoke hearts and a liberal amount of spices including oregano, parsley, thyme, and basil. Lastly, I added a can of tomato paste to thicken the sauce up. A quick and healthy meal!

I didn't have any mushrooms. So that was omitted. Next time I make this I'm going to be sure I have mushrooms. This recipe was absolutely delicious. My family loved it!
It was a simple recipe but so so good!
You gotta try it!

Ellen this is a fabulous recipe and you are right- the listed ingredients are what make it 'yours'. I don't like when people change so many things in a recipe and then rate the original! I just wanted to say that I had 3 large chicken breasts on hand, so I used them. I also didn't use the rosemary. I used lots of garlic and was faithful to your other ingredients, mixing orange juice to the wine. Oh yeah....I added chopped celery. I made it in a large dutch oven. I think it is wonderful and my family does too. A crusty Italian bread to sop up the delicious juices makes it a keeper. Thanks for giving it to us.

I have made this several times already and I read the reviews before making it the first time. We LOVE this dish! Firstly, the orange juice makes this recipe stand out for me. Also, without the tomato paste, it is a soupy dish which lends well to making a soup dish with the leftover sauce. I like my sauce thicker so I do add tomato paste. With my left over sauce, I make a tomato soup the next day and add some chicken broth, lemon juice and shredded chicken to it. Really, you can also add vegetables in it but what makes it for me is the base sauce. Enjoy!

Delicious and easy to make. I was serving it over rice so I didn't want too much of tomato sauce in it, I only put about 4 ounces of tomato sauce Goya Spanish style. The orange juice gives it a unique flavor and the orangey color. This was great! My family loved it and the recipe is now safely kept in my favorites folder ??

I used baby portobello mushrooms (the recipe did not specify the type), a can of ground peeled tomatoes in place of the diced tomatoes and, in addition to the rosemary, salt and pepper - oregano and garlic powder; I served it with baked broccoli, cauliflower & sweet potato. 
The chicken was super tender, falling right off the bone & the gravy was so delicious that I ate it separately with bread!
Yummy, I used masala wine it's what I always have in cabinet!
Delicious. I added kalamata olives.
Very good! I made it with pork chops though and it was delicious.

My husband gave this 5 stars! I used fresh rosemary (1 t dry = 1 T fresh so I used 6 T fresh) and 4- 5lbs of drumsticks and thighs (6 drumsticks, 4 thighs). I cooked it in the crock pot on low for roughly 7 hours. The only change i made was to add 6 oz of tomato paste during the last hour because the sauce was very thin. We put it in the fridge overnight so the flavors could blend and had it for dinner the next day over pasta.

Made it with cut half-game hens because that's what I had. Really felt like I was in Italy. Meat fell off the bone. Had Marsala so used that. As others, added small can of tomato paste. Definitely thickened it. Put over wide egg noodles with Parmesan. It was DELICIOUS!

I gave this recipe 5 stars because it reminded me of my mom's recipe, was easy and I was hungry, and was ready by the time the rice and salad were done. Thanks to the original poster for the note about accompaniments.
This is a wonderful, tasty recipe...I have no idea how anyone could claim otherwise ....
I followed this recipe to a T. No changes at all and it was perfect! Chicken had a wonderful flavor and was moist and delicious! This recipe is a keeper!
this was great and easy. I used fresh tomatoes and it was delicious
This is one heck of a dish. loved it. Its texture did remind me of an indian dish I had awhile ago but it is the be(a)st!
Excellent!!!

So many recipes but I decided on this one as DH doesn't like bell peppers that are in many. It is outstanding! I did make it an hour ahead of time and heated it later as DH often works late
 Thank you.

My original review is below. I'm updating it and taking off a star because this time I used the 2 tablespoons of dried rosemary as directed. It absolutely ruined the dish, making it bitter and nearly unedible. 

----------

This came out perfectly. I made it exactly as the recipe directed, except I used fresh rosemary instead of dried.

I followed this recipe to the letter, but used boneless/skinless thighs for the chicken. We found the dish to be so, so. My husband and I were not impressed with the rosemary/tomato combination. I'm returning to my classic recipe for this dish. It was not bad if you like rosemary with tomatoes. we didn't.

Followed recipe pretty close but omitted wine (I am alcohol-free, no longer touch the stuff) and only used 1 Tb crushed rosemary because 2 seemed excessive. The sauce was perfect, not watery as some claimed (maybe due to no wine so less liquid). Husband had seconds! Note to self: use non-stick pan next time, the chicken thighs stuck to my Calphalon pan even with oil. Everything got scraped up in the end but it was a bit of a mess when I removed the cooked thighs from the pan. Will make again.
good taste. Love it.
Made it today, my husband totally loved it. We had jalapeño focaccia bread with it. I think I'd be great over basmati rice as well. Thank you, Ellen!

I followed the recipe exactly interms of ingrediants, I did throw it in a slow cooker though because of a busy day. I thought it was great, my husband thought it had a little too much wine in it so for his preference I would in the future cut that back a bit but that might have just been because it was in the slow cooker or I did not have as much meat cooking in it. Thanks for a great meal!

I followed the recipe exactly except for mushrooms which I didn't have. I thought it was delicious, runny yes, but I actually love runny sauces that you can sop up with bread. The chicken came out very tender. 
My husband and 10 year old son thought it was a bit acidic (the tomato taste was over powering for them) so next time I will try it with half the tomatoes. My 3 year old twins inhaled this and one of them rubbed his tummy and said mmmmm. I served it on white rice and a side of bread. The Rosemary did not seem like too much for us, it gave it a good flavor. Thanks for the recipe!

This was great!!!! it's really a 4.5 star!!!!
I did cut back on the rosemary to 2.5 teaspoons and added a can of tomato paste. I also cut up the thighs in to small pieces sure it boosted the flavor level. Served on top of egg noodles with butter biscuits, Cant wait to try the leftovers, I bet it will be better the 2nd. time around.

This was fantastic. I made it without the mushrooms because I completely forgot them at the store and didn't go back... will not do this again as I REALLY missed them. But everyone loved the taste. Splurged and used fresh squeezed orange juice. Definitely a keeper!
Love this! Lots of liquid, so I chopped up the chicken, served it in bowls and called it soup! Superb! Even better the next day. I will make this all the time.

Definitely add a small can of tomato paste. Even if the original recipe is meant to be a thin sauce it really does work out better with the paste. 

Easily makes enough sauce for 12 oz of penne pasta, probably enough for 16 oz. depending upon the ratio of sauce to pasta that you prefer.

This has a nice mild flavor but is not bland at all. Be sure to top it with grated parm. Even my mushroom hater of a teenage son gobbled it up!
I love chicken cacciatore but my family hates peppers and any vegetables I try to slip in. This recipe is not only simple, but so flavorful! Everyone Loved it- even the picky kids! Great recipe!!
I made this recipe as written and was a little hesitant about the orange juice, but I loved the final flavor!
Made exactly as written except I used fresh rosemary. Delicious!

This was incredibly good, a true keeper. I had to make one substitution because I didn't have white wine. I used the juice from a can of peaches with 2t of Apple cider vinegar. Next time I'll have the white wine. Delicious!
Absolutely delicious ! Even my husband loved it and told me to use this for our family gathering. I followed the recipe exactly and will again. Loved it.
I used chicken breast and didn't use the white wine but it turned out wonderful
This was really good!! I didn't have any orange juice or white wine, so just made it without and it was still delish! I used herbs de provence as that is what I had on-hand. I'll make this again.

This was a very easy and tasty recipe. I had to tweek the recipe but only because I did not have mushrooms, white wine or orange juice. I used a whole cut up chicken, skin and fat removed, except for the wings which were left in tact. I washed, dried and seasoned both sides with salt, pepper and rosemary. I browned in oil and butter and after removing added the onion and garlic and red bell pepper slices, I used red wine (all I had on hand) and had I used crushed or plum canned tomatoes in place of the diced, the sauce would've been thicker for the side of the pasta I made for this. Despite the thin consistency, which is what this recipe aims for, the flavor was excellent. A keeper and remake for sure.

Made this last night for my family. They absolutely loved it. I did not use mushrooms only because I didnt have them. It had a very nice flavor and I used 1/4 cup of OJ because I didnt want it too sweet. I did add more garlic than requested and I added basil. Would definately make again.

Tried this recipe today. It was very good. I made my own changes due to time constraints today. After I browned the chicken and sauteed the onion, garlic mixture, I put everything in a slow cooker for 4 hours. I also added some spaghetti sauce (about 3/4 cup). Since my husband is not crazy about rice or pasta, this was served over mashed potatoes. A real hit with him.
Delicious! Loved the sauce and I'm SO happy that I have left-overs for lunch today!
